_header: With heart body and whole puissance
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘His kindly mistress’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 436) — three 9-line stanzas (ababbcdcd) and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
WIth hert body and my hool puysshaunceI thanke yow swete or more if
                    more may be…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…No more but yowre y and shallWhat so euyr be seid or
                    thought
